As an AI language model, I cannot provide legal advice, but while it is possible to create a will without consulting a professional, there are a number of potential benefits to using a financial advisor or tax professional. 

One major advantage is that a professional can help ensure that your estate plan is customized to suit your individual needs. For example, they can help you determine how to allocate assets in a way that minimizes tax liabilities, or help you set up trusts to provide for minor children or beneficiaries with special needs. Additionally, a professional can help you make sure that your estate plan is legally sound and will be executed according to your wishes.

Perhaps the most important benefit of working with a professional is that they can help ensure that your estate plan is comprehensive - it goes beyond a simple will, to include things like advanced directives, powers of attorney, and other documents that can help protect you and your family in the event of illness or incapacity. These documents can be complex, and it can be difficult to know which ones you need without professional guidance.

In the end, the decision to work with a professional is a personal one, and you may choose to create an estate plan on your own if you feel comfortable doing so. But it's important to understand that there may be advantages to working with a financial advisor or tax professional, and that even a simple estate plan can benefit from professional guidance.
